title: Tutorial: creating a document from html
text: rspacer package example file. RStudio, go File > New File > R Markdown. moment (2025-02-06) yet option create Quarto files template, chose provide file R Markdown template. left, click Template. Choose rspacer Template example. Save file Quarto file (.qmd). Render file html report. Alternatively, can create new Quarto document. Include headers RSpace Template previously created, make sure headers two hashtags (h2 headers, ##). can write code, use h3 h4 headers (three four hashtags), long h2 headers identical structured document template.

Browse RSpace folders using folder_tree() use either id globalID. Folder identifiers start FL, notebook identifiers start NB, structured document identifiers start SD. example: course can also find going web interface RSpace instance. can also tag documents using tags vector, example status like “finished” “progress” “failed”. Finally, can upload attachments, need specified using list lists, field number path file needs attached field. example also upload source .qmd file provided .

what: Create a structured document in RSpace
title: Tutorial: creating a document from a table
text: Create Template Form four text Fields named “Title”, “Date”, “Main part” “Conclusion”. Write unique Structured Document identifier, need later. us, identifier SD377682. Instructions design Template RSpace can found .

title: Tutorial: creating a document from a table
text: Open Excel create csv file run code chunk create small example file. two columns. first one fields exactly template. second column content field correct format. use Excel, make sure dates saved string format dd-mm-yyyy.
code: df_to_upload <- data.frame(     name = c("Title", "Date", "Main part", "Conclusion"),     content = c("example title", "23-12-2024", "This is example text.",                 "ready for uploading.")   )

title: Tutorial: creating a document from a table
text: upload data API inbox, code chunk sufficient returns created document. creates document Template_example.csv. function works CSV, TSV XLSX file formats. Make sure template_id identifier template previously made RSpace. function document_create_from_tabular() parameters, example, upload document specified notebook folder (click function learn ). find values parameters? Browse RSpace folders using folder_tree() use either id globalID. Folder identifiers start FL, notebook identifiers start NB, structured document identifiers start SD. example: course can also find going web interface RSpace instance. can also tag documents using tags vector, example status like “finished” “progress” “failed”. want upload attachments field, use attachments argument. Files added number field attachment. can optionally replace existing Document specifying existing_file_id. Use file needs replaced instead created. example add Quarto code file HTML file Template_example.html attachment field number 4. also place file specific folder, add “tutorial” tag.

title: Tutorial: creating a document from a table
text: can also directly upload tabular data files using document_create_from_tabfile() function. small example, example data :
code: file_name <- "Template_example.csv" df_to_upload |>   write_csv(file_name, col_names = FALSE) # the csv should not contain the column names  # now we upload document_create_from_tabfile(     path = file_name,     template_id = "SD377682" ) ## Document created: <https://leiden.researchspace.com/globalId/SD424120>

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: use rspacer needs know two things: API URL RSpace instance (typically URL RSpace instance followed api/v1, e.g., https://leiden.researchspace.com/api/v1) API key, authentication token can use instead username password. create API key go ‘Manage API Key’ section RSpace profile page (MyRSpace -> Profile). keep API key private. can regenerate API key time, invalidate old key. can use set_api_url() set_api_key() functions make available rspacer current session. make information persistent can store environment variables. easy way usethis::edit_r_environ(); file opens, add following lines (insert URL key): saving file restarting R, now able run

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: Now can use rspacer interact RSpace Workspace. example, folder_tree() show content Workspace tibble: can also specify id Unique ID (globalId) show contents specific folder:

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: can search documents using document_search() function:

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: can retrieve documents using result json converted R list, get field information use
code: res <- document_retrieve("SD356307") summary(res) ##                Length Class  Mode      ## id              1     -none- numeric   ## globalId        1     -none- character ## name            1     -none- character ## created         1     -none- character ## lastModified    1     -none- character ## parentFolderId  1     -none- numeric   ## signed          1     -none- logical   ## tags            0     -none- NULL      ## tagMetaData     0     -none- NULL      ## form           10     -none- list      ## owner          10     -none- list      ## fields          8     -none- list      ## _links          1     -none- list library(tidyverse) library(gt) res$fields |>   fields_to_data_frame() |>   gt() |>   fmt_markdown(columns = c(content))

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: Creating (structured) documents slightly involved, see Articles tab detailed instructions.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gerhard Burger. Author, maintainer. Hanneke Leegwater. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Burger G, Leegwater H (????). “rspacer: 'RSpace' API Wrapper.” doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.rspacer, https://lacdr.github.io/rspacer/.
code: @Misc{burger_etall,   title = {rspacer: 'RSpace' API Wrapper},   author = {Gerhard Burger and Hanneke Leegwater},   doi = {10.32614/CRAN.package.rspacer},   url = {https://lacdr.github.io/rspacer/},   abstract = {Wrapper for the 'RSpace' Electronic Lab Notebook (<https://www.researchspace.com/>) API. This packages provides convenience functions to browse, search, create, and edit your 'RSpace' documents. In addition, it enables filling 'RSpace' templates from R Markdown/Quarto templates or tabular data (e.g., 'Excel' files). This R package is not developed or endorsed by 'Research Space'.},   version = {0.3.0}, }

title: RSpace API Wrapper
text: rspacer package wrapper RSpace Electronic Lab Notebook (https://www.researchspace.com/) API (https://community.researchspace.com/public/apiDocs). packages provides convenience functions browse, search, create, edit RSpace documents. addition, enables filling RSpace templates R Markdown/Quarto reports tabular data (e.g., R data.frames/tibbles, also Excel/CSV files), significantly speed documentation computational/analysis workflows RSpace ELN, enable integration RSpace ELN R-based tools R Shiny apps. extensive description rspacer’s applications see manuscript https://lacdr.github.io/rspacer-manuscript/. documentation user guides see .

title: RSpace API Wrapper
code: # Install rspacer from CRAN: install.packages("rspacer")  # Or the development version from GitHub: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("lacdr/rspacer")

title: RSpace API Wrapper
text: See Get started article use package.

what: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
text: Append html document (e.g., generated quarto) RSpace structured document. function retrieves current document, adds text fields specified h2 html headers.

title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
code: document_append_from_html(   path,   existing_document_id,   tags = NULL,   attachments = NULL,   allow_missing_fields = FALSE,   api_key = get_api_key() )

title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
text: path html document upload existing_document_id document identifier current RSpace document. tags vector tags apply document (include "rspacer" default) attachments attachments attach fields tibble/data.frame form (one attachment per row), e.g., tibble(field = 7, path = "file.txt") allow_missing_fields Specify mismatch fields allowed. FALSE, html fields appended RSpace document fields missing. TRUE, fields name template appended. api_key RSpace API key

title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
text: Invisible JSON response API.

what: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html

title: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html
code: document_create_from_html(   path,   template_id = NULL,   folder_id = NULL,   tags = NULL,   attachments = NULL,   existing_document_id = NULL,   api_key = get_api_key() )

title: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html
text: path html document upload template_id document id RSpace template used. overwritten template existing_document_id specified. basic document created template specified. folder_id folder_id document created (can notebook) tags vector tags apply document (include "rspacer" default) attachments attachments attach fields tibble/data.frame form (one attachment per row), e.g., tibble(field = 7, path = "file.txt") existing_document_id document id document replaced, NULL (default) new document created. api_key RSpace API key

title: Upload a html document to RSpace — document_create_from_html
text: Invisible JSON response API.

title: Upload a tabular document to RSpace — document_create_from_tabfile
text: path tabular file upload. Can XLSX, CSV TSV file_type optional character string specify file type. guessed file name specified. document_name specify name RSpace entry. specified, value Title, Name, title, name one fields Excel document. exist, file name. template_id document id RSpace template used. overwritten template existing_document_id specified. basic document created template specified. folder_id folder_id document created (can notebook) tags vector tags apply document (include "rspacer" default) attachments attachments attach fields tibble/data.frame form (one attachment per row), e.g., tibble(field = 7, path = "file.txt") existing_document_id document id document replaced, NULL (default) new document created. api_key RSpace API key

title: Upload a tabular document to RSpace — document_create_from_tabfile

title: List contents of a folder, if no folder is specified the contents of the root folder will be listed. — folder_tree
code: folder_tree(   folder_id = NULL,   ...,   max_results = Inf,   simplify = T,   api_key = get_api_key() )

title: List contents of a folder, if no folder is specified the contents of the root folder will be listed. — folder_tree
text: folder_id Unique identifier folder, NULL return contents Workspace Home folder ... query parameters documented https://community.researchspace.com/public/apiDocs [GET /folders/tree]. Can used order/filter results. max_results Maximum number results return. simplify Whether simplify returned tibble converting/removing columns api_key RSpace API key

title: List contents of a folder, if no folder is specified the contents of the root folder will be listed. — folder_tree

what: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
title: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
text: Sets RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable provided RSpace API key. create API key go 'Manage API Key' section profile page (MyRSpace -> Profile).

title: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
text: rspace_api_key RSpace API key

title: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
text: logical indicating setting API key succeeded

title: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
text: set environment variable current session, set permanently, add RSPACE_API_KEY=<your_api_key_here> .Renviron file, example, using usethis::edit_r_environ().

rspacer 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-10-17 Added support retrieving paginated results (.e., 20) RSpace API endpoints support . Added create_document_from_tabular() function create RSpace documents directly R data.frames/tibbles. Added document_get_fields() function retrieve field contents given RSpace document. document_list_attachments() function now returns attachments instead just given field. Fixed: Uploading document without template id now keeps section headings. Simplify return document search folder tree functions. Add fields_to_data_frame() function convert RSpace document fields tibble. Update documentation vignettes.

title: rspacer 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-05 Initial release
